intro: Reutera dichotoma, commonly known as the forked reutera, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often branched stems. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a fragrant, aromatic scent. Reutera dichotoma is often found in coastal and lowland forest environments, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
